Package ru.nsu.lebedev.pizzeria

Class MyBlockingQueue<T>

java.lang.Object
ru.nsu.lebedev.pizzeria.MyBlockingQueue<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of elements held in this queue.
public class MyBlockingQueue<T> extends Object
MyBlockingQueue is a custom implementation of a blocking queue using ReentrantLock and Conditions.

SOLID principles applied: - Single Responsibility Principle: The class manages thread-safe access to the queue. - Open/Closed Principle: It can be extended with new features without modifying its core behavior.

Key conditions: - notEmpty: Signals threads waiting to poll an element that the queue is no longer empty. - notFull: Signals threads waiting to add an element that space is available.

The lock is used to ensure that checking conditions and performing queue operations happen atomically.

  • Constructor Details

    • MyBlockingQueue

      public MyBlockingQueue(int maxSize)
      Constructs a blocking queue with the specified maximum size.
      Parameters:
      maxSize - the maximum number of elements the queue can hold.

    • MyBlockingQueue

      public MyBlockingQueue(ArrayList<T> data)
      Constructs a blocking queue with initial data, setting maximum size to data size.
      Parameters:
      data - initial list of elements for the queue.

  • Method Details

    • maxSize

      public int maxSize()
      Returns the maximum capacity of the queue.
      Returns:
      the maximum size of the queue.

    • size

      public int size()
      Unreliable, reliable only for a moment after returning data. Returns the current size of the queue, ensuring thread safety with a lock.
      Returns:
      the current number of elements in the queue.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Unreliable, reliable only for a moment after returning data. Checks if the queue is empty, ensuring thread safety with a lock.
      Returns:
      true if the queue is empty, false otherwise.

    • getListCopy

      public ArrayList<T> getListCopy()
      Returns a shallow copy of the current queue elements, ensuring thread safety.
      Returns:
      a list containing the current elements.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the queue, preventing further additions and signaling waiting threads. After closing, poll() will return Optional.empty() if the queue is empty.

    • poll

      public Optional<T> poll() throws InterruptedException
      Retrieves and removes the head of the queue, waiting if empty until an element is added or the queue is closed. If the queue is closed and empty, returns Optional.empty().
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the head element, or Optional.empty() if the queue is closed and empty.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting.

    • poll

      public Optional<T> poll(long timeoutMs) throws InterruptedException
      Retrieves and removes the head of the queue with a timeout, waiting up to the specified time for an element to become available. If the queue is closed and empty, returns Optional.empty().
      Parameters:
      timeoutMs - the maximum time to wait in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the head element, or Optional.empty() if the queue is closed and empty or timeout occurs.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting.

    • add

      public void add(T element) throws InterruptedException
      Adds an element to the queue, waiting if full until space is available. Throws IllegalStateException if the queue is closed.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to add.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the queue is closed.
      InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting.

    • add

      public boolean add(T element, long timeoutMs) throws InterruptedException
      Adds an element to the queue with a timeout, waiting up to the specified time for space to become available. Throws IllegalStateException if the queue is closed.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to add.
      timeoutMs - the maximum time to wait in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      true if the element was added, false if the timeout occurred.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the queue is closed.
      InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting.
